Type.Name: CannotUnloadAppDomainException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CannotUnloadAppDomainException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an attempt to unload an application domain fails.

remarks.para: is thrown when there is an attempt to unload:

item.term: The default application domain, which must remain loaded during the lifetime of the application.
An application domain with a running thread that cannot immediately stop execution.
An application domain that has already been unloaded.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes the exception to be thrown.
example.code: Unhandled Exception: System.CannotUnloadAppDomainException: The default domain cannot be unloaded. at System.AppDomain.Unload(AppDomain domain) at CannotUnloadAppDomainExceptionTest.Main()

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Attempt to unload the AppDomain failed." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The property of the new instance is initialized to .

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
